Question.Subject: Why does my laptop read "connected to wireless network" but cannot access the internet?
Question.Content: My laptop connects to my wireless router without a problem. It even reads connected to the name of my network and states that the connection strength is excellent but when I try to access the internet I can't. Once the internet explorer starts up is shows the general cannot access website page. Can anybody tell me what the problem could possibly be? Thanks in advance.
Question.ChosenAnswer: Try turning off DHCP in your OS, using a static IP and entering your nameserver addresses manually.

Answer.Content: Try turning off DHCP in your OS, using a static IP and entering your nameserver addresses manually.
